definition: Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning

sentences.english: A good example of 'Chinese suck at fighting' is how one presents the Jindynasty.
sentences.chinese: “中国人打仗很烂”的好例子是金朝。

sentences.english: Jin replaced both front of palace of Inspection Division, and the Yuan dynasty, no.
sentences.chinese: 金朝改为殿前都点检司，而元朝不设。

sentences.english: The nationality migration in Jin Dynasty was the result of compelling policy of the government.
sentences.chinese: 金朝社会人口流动是统治阶级强制迁徙的结果。

sentences.english: Jin Dading three years, the Emperor gave the hole as the Daming temple.
sentences.chinese: 金朝大定三年，皇帝赐封该洞为大明禅院。

sentences.english: The Jin literature created by Nuzhen nationalities was a multiple national one.
sentences.chinese: 女真族所建政权下的金朝文学具有多民族特征。

definition: Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
the Southern Song dynasty (1127-1279)
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
Song dynasty (960-1279)/used to distinguish it from 劉宋|刘宋 Song of Southern dynasties (420-479)
Song Dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Western Liao, Khitan kingdom of central Asia 1132-1218
Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
the Northern Song Dynasty (960-1127)
Later Jin of the Five Dynasties (936-946)
Yollig Taxin or Yelü Dashi (1087-1143), Chinese-educated Khitan leader, founder of Western Liao 西遼|西辽 in Central Asia
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Zhao Gou, personal name of the tenth Song Emperor Gaozong 高宗[Gao1 zong1]
Liao and Jin dynasties, namely: Liao or Khitan dynasty (907-1125) and Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
Han of the Five dynasties (951-979), one of ten kingdoms during the Five Dynasties, Ten Kingdoms period (907-960)
Mongolia
